markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Froghemoth](/Monsters.aspx?ID=676)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A terrifying abomination of teeth, tentacles, and unbridled rage, the froghemoth is thankfully rarely encountered even in the deepest swamplands or most remote Darklands caverns. Capable of devouring dinosaurs and even dragons, it is a frighteningly effective ambush hunter, immersing itself in the mire with only its eyestalk protruding and watching in every direction at once with uncanny precision.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Aberration](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 33

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Froghemoth.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Froghemoth](/Monsters.aspx?ID=676)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Aberration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=1" />
<trait label="Amphibious" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=207" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 122 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +25; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), otherworldly vision 30 feet

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +23, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +27

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +8

**Dex** +6

**Con** +7

**Int** -4

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Otherworldly Vision** A froghemoth's alien eyes allow it to perceive creatures within 30 feet, even if they are invisible or ethereal. It can still be fooled by successful [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) checks to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62), but it has Perception DC 38 in such cases. It also sees through and is unaffected by illusions with the [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) trait if they are within 30 feet.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 32 all-around vision

**Fort** +26 

**Ref** +21 

**Will** +23 

</row>

**HP** 285

**Immunities**
electricity

**Electric Torpor** Though a froghemoth is immune to electricity damage, it is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for 1 round whenever it would have otherwise taken electricity damage.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet, swim 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +27 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d12+14 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tentacle +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d8+14 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tongue +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d10+14 piercing plus barbed tongue

**[Aquatic Ambush](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=2)** <actions string="Single Action" />  

**Barbed Tongue**   A creature hit by the froghemoth's tongue becomes [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) by the froghemoth. The creature isn't [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24), but it can't move beyond the reach of the froghemoth's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a successful Strike against AC 31 that deals at least 15 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the froghemoth but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes 1 minute.

**Flailing Tentacles** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The froghemoth makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These count toward the froghemoth's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

**[Greater Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=19)** <actions string="Single Action" />  3d6+12, DC 33

**Retract Tongue** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The froghemoth pulls a creature grabbed by its tongue toward itself. The froghemoth rolls an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the froghemoth pulls the creature into an adjacent space, and if it critically succeeds it can also make a bite Strike against the creature after the pull.

**[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Large, 3d6+9 bludgeoning, Rupture 24

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Alien Origins</title>

Froghemoths have been known to suddenly abandon an established lair to seek a new home, as if in response to some cosmic convergence or subspace signal imperceptible to other creatures. Some argue that the froghemoth is never fully comfortable in any environment because it isn't from this world at all, and that these wanderings are instinctual urges to seek out its true home—a home not represented by the strange world in which the beast finds itself trapped.
</aside>
name: Froghemoth
